message: Guess I'll have to get those solar cells and cut out the middlemen.

Some information regarding Fukashima. As this article states there are people working the problem. Fortunately from the articles I've researched, the Pacific is gradually diluting what's currently within the water. Might take several human lifetimes to be completely gone. However nature will bounce back. That I have no doubt on given this planets history.

Jessica Coleman-it was NOT aimed at you, so don't take it so personally & I WAS NOT calling this dad a narcissist, so I was not presuming anything actually. It was a general statement about anyone who feels the need to constantly video tape themselves doing anything & putting it out there for everyone, that's called narcissism, look it up. It wasn't directed at one person.

And I quote: """"If modern medicine didnâ€t have symptoms they wouldnâ€t have a reason to â€œpracticeâ€ medicine. For medicine is primarily symptomology."""" Amen to that! The assumption and current scientific paradigm is that the human body functions as machines function, so modern medicine works in the same way mechanics work on a broken car. But, more and more, we are now finding out our bodies are more like depositories of millions and millions of ecosystems, individual, interdependent, complex and unknown. More shocking; the ancient traditional foods and medicines that have been passed down, generation after generation, seem to be much more beneficial to us than all our modern mumbo jumbo.
I think the research is rigged.
